verbose: What are your earnings for the round in the previous example if the payoff is ${hpayoff} and you chose to pay the initial investment cost (${initial})?
What are your earnings for the round in the previous example if the payoff is ${lpayoff} and you choose to pay the initial investment cost (${initial})?
What are your earnings for the round in the previous example if you choose not to pay the initial investment cost (${initial})?

What would have been your earnings for the round in the previous example if the payoff were {hpayoff}, and you had chosen to pay both the initial investment cost (${initial}) and the final investment cost (${final})?

What would have been your earnings for the round in the previous example if the payoff were ${lpayoff}, and you had chosen to pay both the initial investment cost (${initial}) and the final investment cost (${final})?
What would have been your earnings in this round (same conditions as above) if you chose to pay only the initial investment cost, but not the final investment cost?
Would you be able to release the payoff by paying the final investment cost if you do not pay the first investment cost?
What are your earnings for the round in the previous example if the payoff is ${hpayoff} and you chose to pay the initial investment cost (${initial}) and the final investment cost (${final})?
What are your earnings for the round in the previous example if the payoff is ${lpayoff} and you chose to pay the initial investment cost (${initial}) and the final investment cost (${final})?
What are your earnings for the round in the previous example if you choose not to pay the initial investment cost (${initial}) and the final investment cost (${final})?
